questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. A network engineer is trying to retrieve SNMP MIBs with RESTCONF on the Cisco switch but fails. End-to-end routing is in place. Which configuration must the engineer implement on the switch to complete the task?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
answer is B

snmp-server community private RW
so netconf-yang config should be
netconf-yang cisco-ia snmp-community-string private.

since D is private with capital "P", so D is incorrect.
option B replace "snmp-server community private RW" become "snmp-server community cisco RW" and it match with "netconf-yang cisco-ia snmp-community-string cisco".
B is ok, the community string mistmatched with D!
i am between B and D

choices.E: Configure the route map to set the MED 50 attribute for R5-R4 BGP peering.
choices.A: Apply the AS-Path route-map policy for traffic received from R3.
choices.C: Apply the MED route-map policy for traffic received from R4.
choices.D: Configure a higher Local preference for R5-R4 BGP peering.
choices.B: Configure the route map to prepend the AS-Path attribute for R5-R3 BGP peering.

comments.content:
Agree B and D but the other way around. thoughts?
,B. (R5)Configure the route map to prepend the AS-Path attribute for R5-R3 BGP peering. (incoming traffic through R3 less preferred)
D. (R5)Configure a higher Local pref for R5-R4 (prefixes in) [outgoing traffic to R4 instead of R3]]

discussion.content:
B and D
B. Configure the route map to prepend the AS-Path attribute for R5-R3 BGP peering. [ outgoing traffic of R5 via R4]
D. Configure a higher Local preference for R5-R4 BGP peering [incoming traffic to R5 via R4]
E is incorrect because MED is not advertised by R4 to other ASs.

It is not clear where the changes are made, but assuming changes are applied on 65050 answer is B and D
 
B. As path prepend alters the best path for 65010 to reach 65050. Because of longer path, 65010 is going to select the right hand side paths 
D. Increasing local preference alters the best path for 65050 when reaching 65010. It. will select the right hand side
Pergunta muito mal formulada. Na vida real não administramos o ASN de outro provedor para fazer essa manipulação.

Selected Answer: AB
Configuring inbound traffic (traffic coming into 172.16.50.10)
BGP attributes for inbound are MED and AS-Path
AS-Path comes first in priority.

Cannot be AS-Path and LP (ans B and D), it has to choose one attribute in other of priority

Selected Answer: AB
A and B is the answer

Selected Answer: AB
For me is A & B , configure policy and apply it on the interface. Local Pref is only working for outgoing traffic in the same AS, we have only one router in AS 65050, so weight would be a solution but local Pref. For local Pref we would need at least 2 routers in 65050 for this to work

Selected Answer: BD
Agree with ccie_race

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. Users in AS 65010 are connected with the application server in AS 65050 with these requirements:
AS 65010 users are experiencing latency and congestion to connect with application server 172.16.50.10.

//IMG//
✑ AS 65030 must be restricted to become Transient Autonomous System for traffic flow.
✑ Links connected to AS 65020 and AS 65040 are underutilized and must be used efficiently for traffic.
Which two configurations must be implemented to meet these requirements? (Choose two.)

choices.A: It bypasses the use of MPLS in the service provider core and transmits packets using IP only.
choices.B: It uses pseudowires to route unicast and broadcast traffic over either a service provider MPLS or IP core.
choices.C: It allows VRF traffic to use the service provider MPLS VPN to route multicast traffic.
choices.D: It creates GRE tunnels to route multicast traffic over a service provider IP core.

discussion.content:
C

The Multicast VPN (MVPN) feature provides the ability to support multicast over a Layer 3 VPN. As enterprises extend the reach of their multicast applications, service providers can accommodate these enterprises over their Multiprotocol Label Switching (MPLS) core network. IP multicast is used to stream video, voice, and data to an MPLS VPN network core.

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/ios-xml/ios/ipmulti_mvpn/configuration/xe-16/imc-mvpn-xe-16-book/imc-cfg-mc-vpn.html

Selected Answer: C
Answer is C

comments.content: Agree. mVPN does not use MPLS, but uses an MDT (which is a multicast domain tree in the service provider). From the link provided by Troozi "MVPN does not use label switching." Correct Answer is A

discussion.content: I think its A. mVPN does not use mpls but the ip multicast as underlay.

questions.question_text: What is a characteristic of MVPN?
Which action does the ingress VTEP perform on traffic between EVPN VXLAN overlays?

choices.C: routing and tunneling when doing symmetric IRB
choices.A: routing and bridging when doing asymmetric IRB

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Asymmetric IRB ingress VTEP
- routes the incoming packet into its destination VLAN
- bridges and tunnels the packet within the destination VLAN over to the receiving VTEP with the MAC address

Symmetric IRB ingress VTEP
- tunnels the packet over the transit VNI over to the receiving VTEP
- then: the receiving VTEP routes the packet into the correct destination VLAN and then bridges it to the destination MAC address

So while C sounds correct, the ingress VTEP doesn't do the routing, that's the job of the egress VTEP

comments.content: yeah that makes no sense... VXLAN is datacenter technology...

discussion.content: EVPN VXLAN in the SPCOR exam? It is not int the blueprint

Selected Answer: A
In the provided link you can find:
With asymmetric IRB, the ingress VTEP performs both Layer-2 bridging and Layer-3 routing lookup, whereas the egress VTEP performs only Layer-2 bridging lookup.

choices.C: router(config)# interface ethernet 1/1router(config-if)# ip ospf hello-interval
choices.A: router(config)# router ospf 11router(config-if)# no passive-interface ethernet 1/1
choices.D: router(config)# interface ethernet 1/1router(config-if)# ip ospf priority 0

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
After executing router ospf 11, we enter (config-router)#, not (config-if)#.
However, considering the exhibit, which shows (config-if)#, the correct answer could be A.

questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. An engineer started to configure a router for OSPF. Which configuration must the engineer perform on the router without changing any interface configuration so that the router establishes an OSPF neighbor relationship with its peer?
